title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

09:44 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <+tmortagne> is there a way to disable CSRF ? It's pretty painful when coding  
10:37 <vmassol> yes  
10:38 <vmassol> in xwiki.properties  
10:39 <+tmortagne> hmm indeed, Eclipse could not find me "csrf" in that file  
10:39 <+tmortagne> ok was not foing to work when searching for crsf...  
10:40 <+tmortagne> is the doc in xwiki.properties wrong or I'm not up to date ? it's saying that the default is disabled  
10:40 <+tmortagne> checking sources  
10:41 <+tmortagne> nop the doc seems wrong  
10:41 <vmassol> it's been enabled by defailt now AFAIK  
10:41 <vmassol> maybe the doc hasn't been updated  
10:41 <+tmortagne> so is it a bug or is it expected that it's enabled by default ?  
10:41 <vmassol> abusenius may have forgotten it  
10:42 <vmassol> it's enabled by default voluntarily  
10:42 <vmassol> there's  a jira issue  
10:42 <+tmortagne> that's what I remembered too for integration test but was not sure  
10:42 <vmassol> (I think)  
10:43 <vmassol> can't find it though  
10:43 <vmassol> if you know where the default is you could check who made a modification on it  
10:43 <vmassol> to find the jira issue  
10:43 <+tmortagne> XWIKI-6773  
10:44 <vmassol> open?  
10:44 <vmassol> that's why I coudn't find it...  
10:44 <vmassol> was looking in closed issues  
10:44 <+tmortagne> yep but still committed  
10:44 <vmassol> he must have forgotten to close it  
10:44 <+tmortagne> alex forgot yo close it  
10:45 <+tmortagne> fixing the doc and closing it  
10:45 <vmassol> can you close it?  
10:45 <vmassol> ok thanks  
10:45 <+tmortagne> hmm was it there in 3.1M2 ?  
10:45 <vmassol> you'll need to check the commit  
10:45 <vmassol> (I don't know)  
10:51 <@cjdelisl1> http://xwiki.pastebay.com/136938  
10:54 <vmassol> btw cjdelisl1you know that you can do this completely automatically? :)  
10:54 <vmassol> (using aspects)  
10:55 <vmassol> I documented it here:  
10:55 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Debugging#HGeneratingadebugversionofXWiki  
10:55 <@cjdelisl1> that was done automaticly but devising the command was tough so if there's an easier way I'm interested.  
10:56 <vmassol> you can check the aspect used and tune it to your specific needs too (I used to do that a lot a few years ago)  
10:58 <vmassol> the file is LogAspect.aj  
11:00 <@cjdelisl1> That looks useful. I don't know just how I would use it to get all of the synchronized calls but there are plenty of other things that would be nice to know, eg: what methods are the hotspots  
11:01 <vmassol> I don't know if you can capture synchronized blocks with aspectj  
11:01 <vmassol> (never done it at least)  
11:02 <vmassol> the power of aspects is incredibe  
11:02 <vmassol> there's a bit of a learning curve but the power is amazing  
11:06 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:07 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <lucaa> has quit  
11:22 <+mflorea> vmassol: are you familiar with this error http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/355/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/AllTests/org\_xwiki\_test\_ui\_AllTests/ ?  
11:22 <+mflorea> extension "RANDR" missing on display ":1.0"  
11:24 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <vmassol> mflorea: I think it means x11 is not running  
11:24 <vmassol> it may have crashed  
11:24 <+mflorea> I'll ping the infra team  
11:24 <vmassol> no need  
11:25 <vmassol> restarting the agent should be enough  
11:25 <lucaa1> has quit  
11:25 <+mflorea> ok  
11:25 <vmassol> you can do that from jenkins  
11:25 <+mflorea> yep  
11:25 <+mflorea> I'll do it  
11:25 <+mflorea> another jvm crash http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/7644/console  
11:58 <+mflorea> tmortagne: there is a LDAP tests failing on 3.1 branch http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/355/testReport/ . It fails locally too. Can you take a look?  
11:59 <+tmortagne> mflorea: yes I just seen it but I don't see why yet, it's probably not really related to LDAP  
11:59 <+tmortagne> finishing something and I will look  
12:00 <+mflorea> in the screenshot I see "Invalid credentials" when trying to login with the LDAP account  
12:00 <+mflorea> could be some configuration issue  
12:11 <xipe> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <+mflorea> vmassol: maybe you can take a look at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/355/testReport/ they fail locally too.  
12:20 <vmassol> mflorea: actually I asked tmortagne to look at them several times already but I think tmortagne couldn't find the reason so far. tmortagne?  
12:21 <+tmortagne> vmassol: theses seems recent (age 4)  
12:21 <vmassol> yes because they flicker  
12:21 <vmassol> they' been flickering for months  
12:21 <+tmortagne> 4 is a lot for flickering  
12:21 <vmassol> at least 3-4 months minimum  
12:22 <+tmortagne> I don't remember that  
12:22 <+mflorea> they failed locally from the first run  
12:22 <vmassol> maybe it's a difrent problem every time but the output is exazctly the same  
12:22 <vmassol> in any case every time it has failed on CI we've not done anything to fix it  
12:23 <+tmortagne> the old one I remember was about IP issue and the message has nothing to do with that  
12:23 <vmassol> and it started to work again … and fail agian....  
12:23 <+tmortagne> and I fixed the IP issue  
12:23 <vmassol> yes but one was different  
12:23 <vmassol> \*but that  
12:23 <vmassol> it was failing before that  
12:23 <vmassol> (from time to time)  
12:23 <vmassol> anywa let's fix this one...  
12:26 <vmassol> has quit  
12:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:34 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
12:51 <microblue> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <microblue> I think the bug I18N when upload an file with non english char is an MAN MADE bug!  
12:53 <microblue> there is an function removed all chars expept  number and english char.  
12:54 <microblue> that is an MAN MADE bug, who is an shit!  
12:56 <microblue> we have fixed that bug, modified com.xpn.xwiki.web.UploadAction.class of xwiki-core-3.0.jar  
12:57 <vmassol> calling the developers shit is not going to help you get this thing fixed if you need some help ;)  
12:57 <vmassol> (microblue)  
12:57 <+evalica> every piece of software is man made  
12:57 <vmassol> microblue: you have every right to be frustrated but be respecetful please ;)  
12:57 <microblue> the bug submitted 2 years by users, but no one arrange that.  
12:58 <vmassol> microblue: how much did you pay to get it fixed?  
12:58 <microblue> until we found that, but that is not an mistake,  
12:58 <vmassol> (pay as in money or time or…)  
12:59 <microblue> that is somebody man made. and don't want to fix.  
12:59 <vmassol> sure don't use xwiki if you don't like it  
12:59 <vmassol> nobody is forcing you  
12:59 <vmassol> lunch time here! bbl  
12:59 <microblue> if any one want to use the patch, I will offer that freely.  
13:00 <vmassol> submit the patch  
13:00 <vmassol> to jira  
13:00 <vmassol> or better  
13:00 <vmassol> as a pull request in github  
13:00 <+Enygma`> sure, submit the patch so that everyone can benefit :)  
13:00 <+evalica> jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/  
13:00 <vmassol> and it'll get applied if it's good  
13:01 <microblue> xwiki is an company now, I don't think they can not fix that, they just want the bug exist for ever, until pay them.  
13:02 <+Enygma`> xwiki is an open source project  
13:02 <+Enygma`> sure, there is a company behind that is helping the development of the open source project, but that's that  
13:02 <+evalica> microblue: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing#HFixingbugsornewFeatures2FImprovements  
13:02 <+Enygma`> if you want something from the community or want to help, please follow the steps on xwiki.org  
13:03 <pturcotte> has quit  
13:04 <+Enygma`> also, please note that some of the online documentation/processes might be updated. Don`t hesitate to fix or to report such problems.  
13:05 <microblue> they keep the bug intentionally.  
13:06 <+Enygma`> if intentional bugs would be left in the code, then there would be unhappy users and clients. No sane community/company wants unhappy users/clients.  
13:07 <mflorea> has quit  
13:09 <microblue> <Enygma`>  are you an developer of xwiki?  
13:09 <jstoldt> microblue: i implemented an xwiki in a corporate environment and i found the devs here not just very reasonable but also helpful  
13:09 <jstoldt> they assisted me with all kinds of problems and bugs i had for free  
13:09 <jstoldt> and were happy about contributions i could make  
13:10 <jstoldt> so much rather than mindlessly bitching at them because you found an issue you consider to be made on purpose you could actually quit the bitching and contribute by just offering your solution  
13:11 <microblue> you are lucky, I submit my questions several days before, but no one can give an solution. and I found that bug has been submitted 2 years when it is 1.0 version.  
13:11 <jstoldt> because that is how Open Source works. FOSS is about sharing knowledge and assistance, not about pointing fingers  
13:11 <jstoldt> again, you ought to talk to people and not just hope that any dev will randomly pick one of the hundreds of open bugs on jira  
13:12 <jstoldt> especially if you don't pay for it  
13:12 <jstoldt> i submitted a crash on save bug for LibreOffice a few weeks back. it took more than two weeks for someone to actually dig into it and even now the issue remains unclosed  
13:13 <jstoldt> so it's really you who is wrong  
13:13 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <microblue> yeah, you are right, only if the bug is an reasonable bug.  
13:13 <jstoldt> don't tell me you never created a random bug which made your eyes water when you found it  
13:14 <jstoldt> or are you really that much of an egomanic prick that you can not be failed... EVER?  
13:14 <microblue> if someone keep the bug intentionally, and just you meet the bug, what do you feel  
13:15 <jstoldt> you have shit proof anybody kept anything intentionally so you should just refrain from attacking the people who bring you such a huge piece of software  
13:15 <jstoldt> its disgraceful and if i you had attacked me like that i would actually be a lot less friendly than they are  
13:19 <microblue> if someone made some bugs in an opensource sofeware intentionally, than he is not worth respect.  
13:20 <jstoldt> okay, you are a egomanic prick :)  
13:20 <jstoldt> never mind then, there is prolly no helping you  
13:22 <microblue> is there xwiki developer here?  
13:23 <microblue> how many developers of xwiki,are they offen come here and talk with users?  
13:47 <+tmortagne> microblue: right now there is 5 XWiki core committers and there is usually more but I for one have other thing to do than answer so nice people, I you were kindly asking instead of calling XWiki SAS so kind of scammer I could have told you right away that as far as I remember the filter has been done on purpose a long time ago because some special characters were not well supported behind the scene after the actually upload the attachm  
13:47 <+tmortagne> so no it was not an intentional bug  
13:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <+tmortagne> I would add that out of 5, 2 of the core commiters are not XWiki SAS employees. If you want to learn a bit more about XWiki SAS relationship with the open source project XWiki you can look at http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Community/OpenSource  
14:08 <microblue> has quit  
14:09 <microblue> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <vmassol> mflorea: skype ping  
14:11 <vmassol> nm  
15:13 <+tmortagne> mflorea: did you updated 3.1 enterprise tests to work with FF6 ?  
15:15 <+mflorea> yes, I think I did  
15:15 <+tmortagne> LDAP project included ?  
15:15 <+mflorea> all that were using selenium  
15:23 <+tmortagne> mflorea: is there something special to do ? when I do mvn clean install it start FF and then get stuck, the last line I get in the log is "15:21:36,559 INFO  [org.openqa.selenium.server.browserlaunchers.FirefoxChromeLauncher] Launching Firefox..."  
15:23 <+tmortagne> as far as I can see in the about it's Firefox 6.0  
15:27 <+mflorea> tmortagne: hmm, I was able to run locally the LDAP tests on the 3.1 branch  
15:27 <+mflorea> it took some time to start XE, but they run eventually  
15:28 <+tmortagne> how many ? :)  
15:28 <+tmortagne> much  
15:28 <+tmortagne> I waited for 5 minutes  
15:29 <+mflorea> not that much, let me try again  
15:30 <+tmortagne> to me more precise what I exactly execute in my "mvn" script is  
15:30 <+tmortagne> export MAVEN\_OPTS=-Xmx1024m && export PATH=/media/data/install/linux/utils/firefox-6.0$PATH && mvn $@  
15:30 <+tmortagne> because my current FF is 7  
15:30 <+tmortagne> tried with it first but did not work either  
15:31 <+mflorea> my FF is 6, so I simply do mvn clean install  
15:31 <+tmortagne> the PATH seems ok since the proper FF is started  
15:31 <+tmortagne> but it does not do anything else  
15:32 <+mflorea> maybe the FirefoxDriver is not able to connect. What if you change the code where the FirefoxDriver is initialized and hardcode the path  
15:35 <+tmortagne> where is it ?  
15:35 <+tmortagne> platform-test ?  
15:35 <+mflorea> just a sec  
15:35 <+tmortagne> ha no probably test-ui  
15:35 <+tmortagne> test-selenium I mean  
15:35 <+mflorea> hmm, wait  
15:36 <+mflorea> for selenium 1 you can add the path in pom.xml  
15:36 <+mflorea> after the firefox\*  
15:36 <+mflorea> in the profile  
15:36 <+mflorea> the FirefoxDriver change was for selenium 2  
15:38 <+tmortagne> how do I put the path ? I put the full path instead of just "firefox" ?  
15:39 <+tmortagne> ha found it in the otherbrowser example  
15:40 <+tmortagne> note that I used use the same script to run old test with FF 3 and it worked well  
15:41 <+mflorea> I see, I was putting the path after firefox\* /path/to/firefox  
15:42 <+tmortagne> (the good thing is that it avoid committing wrong stuff by mistake as I usually do :))  
15:42 <+mflorea> :)  
15:43 <+tmortagne> same :(  
15:43 <+mflorea> :(  
15:43 <+tmortagne> hmm "15:43:16,457 WARN  [org.openqa.selenium.server.browserlaunchers.locators.BrowserLocator] Caution: '/media/data/install/linux/utils/firefox-6.0/firefox': file is a script file, not a real executable.  The browser environment is no longer fully under RC control"  
15:43 <+tmortagne> not sure it's important  
15:44 <+mflorea> specify firefox-bin  
15:44 <+mflorea> instead  
15:45 <+tmortagne> that's weird I get the same warning when I give firefox-bin in the path  
15:46 <+tmortagne> ok lets trick it  
15:48 <+tmortagne> no warning anymore but still stuck  
15:48 <+mflorea> :(  
15:49 <+tmortagne> lets check selenium2 tests  
15:49 <+mflorea> I doubt you're get a different result  
15:50 <+tmortagne> that's what I want to check to be sure  
15:54 <+tmortagne> not better  
15:54 <+tmortagne> I don't understand, It used to work well not so long ago  
15:55 <+tmortagne> so now I'm unable to execute any selenium test...  
15:59 <patrek> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <pturcotte> has quit  
16:18 <+tmortagne> mflorea: just tested with FF 3.6.20 and it works well  
16:19 <+tmortagne> at least i'm not stuck but I don't understand what's wrong  
16:20 <+mflorea> how do you check the full version of FF? I see only FF 6  
16:20 <+mflorea> firefox --version  
16:20 <+mflorea> Mozilla Firefox 6.0  
16:20 <+mflorea> that's what I have  
16:21 <+tmortagne> 6.0 is what you can see in the about  
16:21 <+tmortagne> did not checked with --version  
16:21 <+tmortagne> but there is no other version of FF 6 anyway  
16:21 <+mflorea> wait, I misunderstood 3.6.20  
16:21 <+mflorea> I saw only "6.20" :)  
16:21 <+tmortagne> :)  
16:39 <+tmortagne> LDAP test are working well with 3.6.20, that will not help me much...  
16:43 <+tmortagne> mflorea: what I don't understand is why 3.1 is failing and not master, there is no difference between the two AFAIK  
16:44 <+mflorea> I don't know either  
17:19 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
17:20 <+jvdrean> Hi, I'm trying to build platform on a clean OS and I get the following:  
17:20 <+jvdrean> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project xwiki-platform-formula-renderer: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-formula-renderer:jar:3.2-SNAPSHOT: Failure to find uk.ac.ed.ph.snuggletex:snuggletex-jeuclid:jar:1.1.0 in http://maven.xwiki.org/externals was cached in the local repository, resolution will not be reattempted until the update interval of xwiki-externals has elapsed or updates are forced  
17:20 <+jvdrean> and indeed I can't find snuggletex-jeuclid in http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/uk/ac/ed/ph/snuggletex/  
17:21 <vmassol> yes  
17:21 <vmassol> I've seen the error in nexus  
17:21 <vmassol> it seems their repo cannot be reached  
17:22 <vmassol> btw thanks to nexus we get this:  
17:22 <+jvdrean> it seems up  
17:22 <+jvdrean> http://www2.ph.ed.ac.uk/maven2/uk/ac/ed/ph/snuggletex/  
17:22 <vmassol> http://pastebin.com/SBcE6r1L  
17:22 <vmassol> (which is pretty cool)  
17:23 <+jvdrean> nice  
17:23 <rstavro> has joined #xwiki  
17:23 <vmassol> jvdrean: it doesn't matter if their repo is not accessible  
17:23 <vmassol> since nexus caches it  
17:24 <vmassol> jvdrean: I see jeuclid here: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/index.html#view-repositories;snuggletex~browsestorage  
17:24 <vmassol> that's a wrong remote repo you're using btw  
17:25 <vmassol> maybe you missed the email on the list announcing the use of nexus now  
17:25 <vmassol> it's documented here too:  
17:25 <+jvdrean> yep that must be it  
17:25 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
17:25 <vmassol> "To build master after 16 August 2011:"  
17:25 <+jvdrean> I see the settings.xml has changed a lot  
18:10 <evalica> has quit  
18:13 <rstavro> has left #xwiki  
18:14 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:31 <arkub> has quit  
18:36 <vmassol> interesting: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/174/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.webstandards/CustomDutchWebGuidelinesValidationTest/Validating\_Dutch\_Web\_Guidelines\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Panels\_u002C\_page\_MyRecentModifications\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/  
18:36 <vmassol> I think this means that somehow we closed the page before the response was fully sent to client  
18:36 <vmassol> maybe the webstandard test fwk doesn't fully read the response?  
18:38 <vmassol> nope we read it fully: http://hc.apache.org/httpclient-3.x/apidocs/org/apache/commons/httpclient/HttpMethodBase.html#getResponseBody()
